alert.note: Alert for Appling; Brantley; Pierce; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Pierce, north central Brantley, southwestern Wayne and southern Appling Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Patterson, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blackshear, Patterson, Screven, Offerman, Bristol, Raybon, Hortense and Broadhurst. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
